New Records: LeBron James became the first Laker since Magic to reach 21 points, 12 rebounds, and 13 assists in a single game.
Key Match Events: LeBron James recorded a triple-double with 21 points, 13 assists, and 12 rebounds.
Anthony Davis scored 31 points, 9 rebounds, and 4 blocks.
Paul George had an abysmal shooting game with just 9 points on 4-of-13 shooting.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts highlighted the importance of strong perimeter defense.
JJ Redick's formula for the Lakers involves maximizing Anthony Davis' offensive ability, while letting LeBron James do what he's done for 22 years.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James received praise for his performance in helping the Lakers get back on track.
The Lakers will be in contention for a top six seed in the Western Conference and avoid the play-in tournament as long as both superstars can stay healthy.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 76ers aren't really in position to challenge anyone right now, as they fell to 1-7 with the loss.
The Lakers will face the Toronto Raptors on Sunday at 9:30 p.m. ET.
Others: The game was played without Joel Embiid and Tyrese Maxey, resulting in a rather lifeless performance from the 76ers' offense.
The Lakers' next game is against the Toronto Raptors on Sunday at 9:30 p.m. ET.
